intro: Rhinanthus serotinus subsp. apterus, commonly known as the late rhinoceros flower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, known for its parasitic nature, although it can photosynthesize. This subspecies typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and heaths. It produces vibrant orange-red flowers that bloom in late summer to autumn. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves.
